Some perspective on the magnitude of bond declines vs. stock declines... Since 1976, the worst year for the Barclays Agg Bond Index was -2.9% in 1994. Over that same time the S&P 500 has declined over 2.9% in more than 100 single trading days. $AGG $SPY

When Bitcoin fell 85% from Dec 2013 to Jan 2015 the S&P 500 was up 12%. Just like Gold, a 0 correlation does not imply that they won't move together at times - they will, both up and down. But a decline in Bitcoin is not predictive of a decline in stocks and vice versa.

Going back to 2010, there is a 0 correlation between S&P 500 and Bitcoin. This should not be a surprise. There is no fundamental reason to expect them to move in the same direction on a consistent basis.
